bioghist.p: The Delaware, Lehigh, Schuylkill, and Susquehanna Railroad Company was incorporated in 1843, and changed its name to the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company in 1853. Known as the Route of the Black Diamond, the line was primarily constructed for the purpose of hauling coal.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of documents from the Lehigh Valley Railroad Company. Materials include: bound volumes of stock certificates and canceled stock certificates (1890-1910); agreements; annual reports; receipts; a 1938 train schedule; proxy post cards for 1935-1936 accounting for 337,000 shares (circa 1100 items); a volume recording interest on installments (1889-1890); dividend books from 1872, 1873, and 1880; and a volume of daily cash statements (1921-1923).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
